c1.title: Intro to Web Development
c1.description: Learn the fundamentals of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

c2.title: Advanced React Patterns
c2.description: Master advanced techniques in React for scalable applications.

c3.title: Data Structures & Algorithms
c3.description: Understand core computer science concepts for efficient problem-solving.

as1.title: HTML & CSS Basics
as1.description: Create a simple personal portfolio page.

as3.title: React Hooks
as3.description: Build a todo list app using React Hooks.

as4.title: Big O Notation
as4.description: Analyze the time complexity of given algorithms.

sub1.content: Here is my portfolio submission. I used Flexbox for the layout.
sub1.feedback: Excellent work! Your CSS is clean and your HTML is semantic.

sub2.feedback: Good job. The logic is sound, but consider adding error handling for division by zero.

sub3.content: My todo list works well, but I had trouble with useEffect.
sub3.feedback: A good attempt. The state management could be cleaner. Let's review the useEffect dependency array rules.

th1.title: Is `var` still used in modern JavaScript?

po1.content: I see `var` in older tutorials, but modern guides use `let` and `const`. Is there any reason to use `var` anymore?

po2.content: Great question! Generally, you should avoid `var` in modern JS. It has some quirky scoping rules (it's function-scoped, not block-scoped) that can lead to bugs. `let` and `const` are block-scoped and safer to use.

n1.message: A new assignment 'React Hooks' has been posted for Advanced React Patterns.

ch1.title: E-commerce Homepage UI
ch1.description: Design and build a responsive homepage for a modern e-commerce site. Focus on a clean UI and intuitive user experience.

ch2.title: User Authentication Flow
ch2.description: Implement a secure user sign-up and login flow. Your solution should include password hashing and session management.

ch3.title: API Data Fetching
ch3.description: Create a component that fetches data from a public API (e.g., a weather API) and displays it cleanly. Handle loading and error states.

proj1.title: My Personal Portfolio
proj1.description: A portfolio site built with React and Tailwind CSS to showcase my projects.

proj2.title: AI Blog Generator
proj2.description: A full-stack application that uses generative AI to create blog posts from a simple prompt. Built with Next.js and Genkit.

google.name: Google
google.description: Tackle a problem in large-scale system design or data processing.

task.title: Design a URL Shortening Service
task.scenario: You're an engineer on the Google Cloud team tasked with designing a highly scalable URL shortening service like bit.ly. The service needs to handle billions of URLs and high request volumes.
task.task: Design the system architecture for this service. Consider the data model, how to generate unique short URLs, and how you would handle read/write traffic.
deliverables: A high-level system architecture diagram.
A description of your data model (e.g., SQL or NoSQL schema).
Pseudo-code for generating a short URL and handling redirects.

openai.name: OpenAI
openai.description: Develop a strategy for implementing a safety-focused AI feature.

task.title: Develop a Content Moderation Filter
task.scenario: As part of the safety systems team at OpenAI, you've been asked to design a multi-layered filter to detect and prevent harmful content generation in a new AI model.
task.task: Propose a design for a content moderation system. Your design should balance safety with user freedom and avoid excessive censorship.
deliverables: A description of at least three layers of your filter.
An example of a prompt that would be flagged and one that would pass, with explanations.
A strategy for minimizing false positives (flagging safe content).

netflix.name: Netflix
netflix.description: Design a system for content delivery and personalization.

task.title: Design a 'Trending Now' Feature
task.scenario: You're on the Netflix personalization team. Your task is to design the logic for the 'Trending Now' row on the homepage, which should update in near real-time.
task.task: Outline an algorithm and system architecture to identify and display trending content. Consider factors like view counts, social media mentions, and regional popularity.
deliverables: An outline of the data points you would track.
A high-level algorithm for calculating a 'trend score'.
A brief explanation of how you would personalize this for different users.

microsoft.name: Microsoft
microsoft.description: Architect a cloud-native solution for enterprise customers.

task.title: Architect a Cloud Backup Solution
task.scenario: As a cloud solutions architect at Microsoft Azure, a client wants a proposal for a secure and cost-effective solution to back up their on-premise file servers to the cloud.
task.task: Propose an Azure architecture for this backup solution. Focus on security, cost-efficiency, and disaster recovery.
deliverables: A list of the Azure services you would use (e.g., Azure Blob Storage, Azure VPN Gateway).
A diagram showing the data flow from on-premise to the cloud.
A brief summary of the security measures you would implement.

aws.name: Amazon Web Services
aws.description: Architect a scalable, serverless backend for a web application.

task.title: Serverless API for a Mobile App
task.scenario: A startup is building a social media app and needs a backend that can scale to millions of users. They want to use serverless technology on AWS to keep costs low.
task.task: Design a serverless architecture using AWS services like API Gateway, Lambda, and DynamoDB to handle user profiles and posts.
deliverables: A system diagram showing the interaction between services.
A sample data model for user profiles in DynamoDB.
Pseudo-code for a Lambda function that creates a new post.

apple.name: Apple
apple.description: Design an intuitive and privacy-focused user feature.

task.title: Design a 'Screen Time' Widget
task.scenario: You're a designer on the iOS team. Your task is to design a new Home Screen widget for 'Screen Time' that is both informative and respectful of user privacy.
task.task: Create a design specification for the widget. It should be available in small, medium, and large sizes and provide useful insights at a glance without being intrusive.
deliverables: Sketches or wireframes for the three widget sizes.
A description of what information each widget size would display.
An explanation of how your design prioritizes user privacy.

meta.name: Meta
meta.description: Develop a strategy for a new feature in a social application.

task.title: Feature Proposal: 'Community Events'
task.scenario: You are a Product Manager for a social media platform. You need to propose a new 'Community Events' feature to encourage local, real-world interactions among users.
task.task: Write a 1-page product brief for this feature. It should outline the problem it solves, the target audience, key functionalities, and metrics for success.
deliverables: A one-paragraph summary of the feature's value proposition.
A bulleted list of 5-7 key functionalities (e.g., 'Create an event', 'RSVP', 'View on map').
A list of 3 Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure success.
